question: Which of the following structures is the footplate of stapes attached to?

answers.option: Margin of internal opening to auditory tube
Margin of the aditus to mastoid antrum

question: A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling something sticking in his throat, difficulty in swallowing, and weight loss. He also gives a history of regurgitating undigested food 4 to 5 hours after consumption. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 28-year-old swimmer presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of intense itching, discomfort, impaired hearing, and watery discharge with a musty odor in his right ear. On otoscopic examination, a brown-colored material is noted in his external auditory canal. What will be the appropriate treatment after suction and cleaning?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of severe earache and high-grade fever for the past 3 days. Ear examination reveals inflamed and retracted tympanic membrane with tender postaural swelling. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 27-year-old man presents to your office with a complaint of discharge from his right ear on and off since his childhood. The discharge is mucoid and profuse in nature. Otoscopy reveals a medium-sized central perforation on the eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 25-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of watery rhinorrhea on bending his head. He had an operation for deviated nasal septum 4 months ago. Anterior rhinoscopy does not reveal any remarkable findings. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 26-year-old male presents with the complaint of a smooth and globular swelling in the left upper part of his neck for the past 5 years without any significant increase in size. There is no history of associated fever or weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male reports to the clinic after a flight with complaints of bilateral severe earache, deafness, and tinnitus. Otoscopy reveals bubbles in the middle ear across a retracted eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male comes to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fibre optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in paramedian position (unilateral abductor paralysis). Which of the following nerves is most likely affected in this patient?
A 5-year-old child presents to the office with a history of recurrent epistaxis. What is the most probable cause of epistaxis in this age group?
Which of the following is the most appropriate statement regarding the pyramidal process of the middle ear?

answers.option: It arises from the basal turn of the cochlea
It is a projection in the epitympanic recess
It encloses the tensor tympani muscle
The tendon of stapedius appears from it's summit
It is located in the roof of the middle ear

question: A farmer develops long-standing late-stage atrophic rhinitis. Which of the following treatments is most preferable to eradicate the disease?

A 40-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in the paramedian position. Which of the following muscles is the main abductor of the vocal cords?

A 19-year-old male comes to the emergency department with complaints of severe pain in the right side of the throat, a thick muffled voice, and painful swallowing. Which of the following is not a clinical feature of quinsy (peritonsillar abscess)?

Noise is an undesirable and unwanted vibration of sound that can cause damage to humans both physically and mentally. The intensity of sound is measured in decibels (dB). Which of the following is the daily acceptable limit of noise that the human ear can tolerate without any substantial damage to hearing?
A mother brings in her 4-year-old boy to the clinic with complaints of severe right-sided earache, high-grade fever, and mild hearing impairment. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-year-old child is brought to the emergency department with complaints of nasal obstruction, epistaxis, and rhinorrhea. Examination reveals watch glass swelling of the nasal septum. Recent history is positive for the child falling from a bed. What is the most likely diagnosis? (CBL)

A 25-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with a history of blocked right ear and itching. Otoscopic examination reveals red, sodden, and edematous skin of the external auditory canal filled with a pale blue material. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male smoker comes to the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath on and off for the past 1 week and a change in voice for the past 2 months. He has also experienced significant weight loss because he could only swallow semisolid meals with difficulty for the past 2 weeks. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 55-year-old male chronic smoker presents with complaints of hoarseness and dyspnea. What will be the most appropriate next step?

answers.option: Course of antibiotics and steam inhalation

question: A 28-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of bilateral hearing loss for the past four years and tinnitus. Pure tone audiometry shows a dip in the bone conduction curve at 2000 Hz. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most dangerous late complication of tracheostomy?

A patient comes to the outpatient department with a history of squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity. Lymph nodes in the cervical region are palpable. He undergoes resection of the tumor along with primary neck dissection. Which of the following structures are preserved in a radical neck dissection?

answers.option: Sternocleidomastoid muscle and spinal accessory nerve
Submandibular gland, internal jugular vein, and tail of parotid gland
All lymph nodes in levels I to V, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and submandibular gland
Internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and spinal accessory nerve
Phrenic nerve, hypoglossal nerve, and carotid artery

question: A 50-year-old male smoker presents with a white plaque of approximately 3 cm on the right lateral border of his tongue for the past 1.5 months. The physician suspects it is leukoplakia. Which of the following is the best management plan?

A shopkeeper comes to an otorhinolaryngologist and is diagnosed with chronic sinusitis. The diagnosis was made after doing a nasal endoscopy. Which of the following is the confirmatory sign for establishing this diagnosis?
A farmer has developed a granuloma in his nose. Biopsy and histopathology of the granuloma reveal epitheliod necrotizing granuloma and vasculitis. Which of the following diseases has these features?

A 55-year-old woman comes to your office with the complaint of vertigo on turning her head to the right and while combing. Past history is relevant for a fall from the stairs around 5 years ago. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following can a peritonsillar abscess extend posteriorly into?

A 35-year-old man, who has a history of chronic renal failure, comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of a creamy, yellowish-white patch on his tongue for the past 5 to 7 days. He is diagnosed with a fungal infection over his tongue. Which of the following fungi is responsible for his condition?
A 50-year-old man with a history of hypertension suddenly develops heavy bleeding from his nose. Which emergency measure will be beneficial for him?

answers.option: Cold sponging and pinching the nose

question: A 12-year-old boy is diagnosed with a thyroglossal duct cyst. Which of the following procedures would be the most appropriate to address his problem?

A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of right-sided facial weakness for the past 1 week. He has a history of diabetes mellitus. A diagnosis of Bell's palsy is made. Which of the following is the best tool for the diagnosis of this condition?

An 18-year-old male who has had a motorbike accident is brought into the emergency department with a blunt neck injury. The patient is in respiratory distress. His pulse is 102/min and his blood pressure is 80/50 mmHg. What will be the immediate management of this patient?

A 55-year-old male, who has a history of diabetes mellitus, presents to the clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear for 3 days and foul-smelling purulent discharge. Examination reveals left-sided facial weakness. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 40-year-old male teacher presents to your clinic with a complaint of hoarseness for the past 6 months. On flexible laryngoscopy, you observe smooth bilateral small swellings at the anterior one-third of both vocal cords. What treatment advice will you give to him?
Frequency and loudness are two properties of sound. Frequency is measured in hertz (Hz). Which of the following frequency ranges most accurately represents the audible frequency for a human being?

A student was asked to make a consent form after being told about valid informed consent and its five elements. Coercion refers to morally inappropriate pressure from individuals or institutions that constrain a patient. Which of the following elements of informed consent is coercion a violation of?

A 62-year-old male suffering from glottic squamous cell carcinoma comes to your clinic. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals an exophytic growth on the right vocal cord. The right vocal cord is also fixed and immobile. Lymph nodes of the neck are not palpable. What is the tumor stage based on these findings?

A 36-year-old female presents to her primary care physician with a complaint of difficulty in opening her mouth for the last 6 months. She has a history of chewing betel nuts for the last 10 years. Examination reveals generalized pale mucosa and fibrosis in the oral cavity with angular cheilitis. She does not have cervical lymphadenopathy. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of bleeding from the nose after suffering a trauma. Which of the following is the most common site of epistaxis?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the doctor's clinic with complaints of severe pain in the right side of his throat, severe odynophagia, high-grade fever, trismus, and dribbling of saliva for the last two days. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old female presents to the emergency department with complaints of pain in the throat, high-grade fever, ipsilateral earache, and restricted mouth opening. On examination, the patient has bulging of the soft palate and anterior tonsillar pillar of the affected side with congested and swollen tonsil. The trismus accompanying peritonsillar abscess (quinsy) is due to the spasm of which muscle?

A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a complaint of watery rhinorrhea on bending forward. He was in a road traffic accident 6 months ago. Examination reveals a scar mark on the bridge of the nose with boggy nasal mucosa. He is suspected to have CSF rhinorrhea. Which test would confirm this diagnosis?

A 20-year-old woman is diagnosed with a branchial fistula on the right side of her neck with an external opening in the lower neck along the anterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle. An x-ray fistulogram reveals that the fistula is communicating with the right tonsillar fossa interiorly. Which of the following is the origin of her congenital problem?
Following neck dissection, a patient complains of difficulty in raising his arm above shoulder level. What is this known as?

A 3-year-old child is brought to the ENT outpatient department with a history of a deformed ear since birth. Examination reveals an abnormally protruding ear with a large concha and poorly developed antihelix and scapha. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male presents to your clinic complaining of a change in his voice. Fibre optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in the paramedian position. Which of the following muscles is responsible for the medialization of the vocal cord?

A 65-year-old male presents to your clinic with complaints of foul-smelling regurgitation of undigested food and weight loss for the last couple of months. He often wakes up coughing in the night. What is the most probable cause of his symptoms?

A 21-year-old female presents to the otorhinolaryngology outpatient department with the complaint of painless and progressive hearing loss. Her hearing is better in noisy surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old woman is receiving chemotherapy for cancer in the oral cavity. After some rounds of chemotherapy, she starts complaining about decreased salivation. Which statement regarding the physiology of salivation is closely related to this patient's complaint?

answers.option: About 500 ml of saliva is secreted in 24 hours
Salivary secretion is serous in nature
Parotid gland is responsible for about 70% of salivary secretions
Salivary secretion contains the enzyme lipase

question: Where will the travelling wave in the basilar membrane reach up to when the frequency of sound is less than 200 Hz?

Noise pollution with sound frequencies ranging from 4000 to 6000 Hz may result in temporary deafness that disappears after some time. Continuous exposure to which intensity of sound may result in permanent deafness?

Ethics is the discipline concerned with what is morally good and bad, right and wrong. Research involving human subjects must be preceded by careful assessment of predictable risks and burdens to the individuals and groups involved in the research. Some groups and individuals are particularly vulnerable and may have an increased likelihood of being wronged or of incurring additional harm. Which of the following is the most vulnerable group?

answers.option: Males between 18 and 22 years of age

question: A middle-aged male is being examined in the ENT outpatient department. He is found to have a non-healing ulcer with a rough surface on the lateral border of the tongue. The ulcer has been there for the past 3 weeks. He has tried a number of topical treatments but they did not have any effect. Loosening of adjacent teeth is also evident. What is your most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In quinsy (peritonsillar abscess), where does the pus collect?

answers.option: Between the capsule of the tonsil and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the vertebral bodies posteriorly and prevertebral fascia anteriorly

question: A 35-year-old lady presents to the outpatient department 6 months after her surgery with the complaint of recurrence of her ear lesion. In which of the following diseases is recurrence usually seen?

A 6-year-old child presents to the clinic with bilateral parotid swelling for the last 5 days. He has also had a fever of 103 °F (39 °C). A diagnosis of bilateral parotitis is made. Family history is positive for similar complaints in a family member a few days ago. What is the incubation period of this disease?
Which of the following is another name for quinsy?
Which of the following structures does the auditory tube run between?

A 4-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother with the complaint of bilateral hearing loss for the last 6 months. She has also been snoring at night. Otoscopy reveals fluid level with air bubbles in both ears along with dull, bluish, and retracted tympanic membranes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

answers.option: Safe type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: At which part of the cochlea is the frequency 20,000 Hz localized?

An 18-year-old male presents to the clinic with a diffuse swelling in the submandibular region, fever, ptyalism, and difficulty in chewing. He also gives a history of toothache. On examination, the swelling is diffuse, firm, and brawny with raised floor of the mouth. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A father brings in his 1.5-year-old child to the clinic with the complaint of inability to speak and unresponsiveness to even loud sounds. On investigation, it is found that the child has bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss. Which of the following treatments is this child the best candidate for?

Tuning fork tests were conducted on a 26-year-old woman. Rinne's test revealed that bone conduction was greater than air conduction in both of her ears. Weber's test was centralized and Schwabach's test was equal to that of the examiner in both ears. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?
Which of the following functions as the sensory receptor for the transduction of sound waves in the organ of Corti?

A 30-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a slow-growing swelling of the left parotid gland for the last 6 years. Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) reveals a parotid tumor. Which of the following is the most common benign lesion of the parotid gland?

A 19-year-old female presents with pain in her right ear, deafness, tinnitus, and discharge. On examination, a pearly white mass is observed in her ear canal. Upon removing the mass, an ulcer and granulation tissue are found in the widened external auditory canal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old male visits the clinic with a complaint of a swelling in the floor of the oral cavity that ruptures and reappears on and off for the last 2 years. Oral examination reveals a transparent globular cystic swelling in the floor of the mouth. What is the most likely clinical diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man is suffering from sudden idiopathic sensorineural hearing loss of moderate degree. He is a known patient of cardiac failure. Which of the following measures is contraindicated for the management of hearing loss in this patient?

A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with halitosis and difficulty swallowing. History is also positive for associated weight loss and regurgitation of undigested food. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 28-year-old female presents to the clinic with a firm and erupted mass at the site she had surgery on for the same lesion 3 months ago. Surgery, pre and post-operative radiation, and local injection of steroids after excision is the preferred modality of treatment in which of the following?
A 34-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of dysphagia to solids for the past 3 years. Her hemoglobin is 7 mg/dl. What will be the most likely finding on a barium swallow?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the boy has an open-mouthed expression with prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A young resident performs an esophagoscopy to remove a foreign body from a 15-year-old boy. One hour later, the patient starts complaining about severe pain between his shoulder blades. Which of the following problems has most likely occurred in this patient?

answers.option: Pressure necrosis from impacted foreign body

question: A middle-aged man works in a nickel refining factory. Which lethal condition might develop in his nasal or paranasal sinuses?

An 18-year-old male presents to the emergency department with complaints of high-grade fever, thick and muffled voice, odynophagia, saliva dribbling from the angle of the mouth, and ipsilateral earache. On examination, the patient has restricted mouth opening, swelling, and congestion of the soft palate on the right side, uvula pushed to the opposite side, and a red and congested anterior pillar. What will the management plan include?

answers.option: Hospitalization with intravenous fluids, antibiotics, analgesics, and maintenance of oral hygiene
Oral antibiotics now and tonsillectomy later

question: A 25-year-old man swallows a walnut by mistake and comes to the emergency department with the complaint of sudden absolute dysphagia; he vomits whatever he eats. An esophagoscopy is planned. The foreign body is expected to be impacted at one of the three normal anatomical constriction sites which are measured from the upper incisors. What are the distances of these sites from the upper incisors?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 22-year-old girl presents to the clinic with painful ulceration on her lower lip. Examination reveals an 8 mm x 4 mm ulcer with a central necrotic area and a red halo. Which of the following is the most acceptable etiological factor for developing aphthous ulcers?
A 25-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of a red, hot, and painful pinna. She is diagnosed with perichondritis. Where is the abscess in perichondritis formed?

answers.option: Between the layers of the skin

question: A 75-year-old lady reports to the emergency department with the complaint of dysphagia to solids following ingestion of her denture. She undergoes esophagoscopy under general anesthesia for removal of the foreign body. Following the removal, she starts complaining about sharp interscapular pain. Which of the following is the most dangerous complication of this procedure?

A 60-year-old man is suffering from a gradual loss of hearing with tinnitus. His audiogram shows a notch at 4 kHz for both air and bone conduction. It is symmetrical on both sides. Which of the following is the cause of his hearing loss?

A 13-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with complaints of profuse and fresh red epistaxis for the past 1 year, decreased hearing, and a bulging cheek. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A middle-aged man is found to have developed an inverted papilloma in his right nasal cavity. Which of the following has traditionally been the treatment of choice for inverted papillomas?

Concerned with the ethics of the health care professionals and their relationship with the patient is Medical Ethics. It provides the standard for human actions to be right or wrong, validate, and trust these standards. Which of the following is the role of a physician in medical ethics?

answers.option: Discuss the patient's status with everyone to get a better insight
Save the patient's life using his or her authority
Force the treatment for the betterment of the patient
Promote and protect the patient's health by hook or by crook

question: A 10-year-old girl has had a midline suprahyoid swelling for the past 5 years that has slowly grown in size. There is no associated history of fever or weight loss. Which of the following is the most important pre-operative investigation required in this patient?
A 50-year-old man is diagnosed with early-stage squamous cell carcinoma of the nose and sinuses. Which of the following is the most common site for the origination of this malignancy?

A 63-year-old male farmer visits the outpatient department with the complaint of a non-healing right-sided buccal ulcer for the last 2 months. The ulcer is 3 x 2 cm in size. Examination reveals right-sided cervical lymphadenopathy on neck palpation. Which single investigation should be done to establish the diagnosis?

answers.option: CT scan of oral cavity and neck
MRI of oral cavity and neck

question: A 21-year-old female, who had been in a road traffic accident 4 days ago, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of persistent swelling, bilateral nasal obstruction, and pain. Examination reveals a bulge on both sides of the nasal septum. Her temperature is 100.5 F. What is the most likely diagnosis?
